required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Canadian VPRIV® Study in Participants Previously Treated With Other Enzyme Replacement Therapies (ERTs)/Substrate Reduction Therapies (SRTs)
clinical_study.official_title: Canadian VPRIV® Non-Interventional Study in Patients Previously Treated With Other Enzyme Replacement Therapies (ERTs)/Substrate Reduction Therapies (SRTs)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to assess safety of velaglucerase alfa (VPRIV) in participants affected with Gaucher disease type 1 (GD1) transitioning from other enzyme replacement therapies (ERTs)/ substrate reduction therapies (SRTs) to VPRIV in a Canadian real-world setting across all age groups.

detailed_description.textblock: 29 APRIL 2020: Enrollment of new patients into this study has been paused due to the COVID-19 situation. The duration of this pause is dependent on the leveling and control of the COVID-19 pandemic.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events (AEs) Following the Transition From Other ERTs/SRTs to VPRIV
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Number of participants transitioning from other ERTs/SRTs to VPRIV with AEs will be reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Use of Glucosylspingosine (Lyso-Gb1) Biomarker
secondary_outcome.description: Change in use of Lyso-Gb1 by participants following the transition from other ERTs/SRTs to velaglucerase alfa (VPRIV) will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Gaucher Disease Questionnaire Score at Month 12
secondary_outcome.description: Gaucher disease questionnaire (PRO) scores will be calculated for each adult participant (greater than or equal to [>=] 18 years). The questionnaire asks how much the participant is affected by the Gaucher disease. A total summated score is calculated and ranges from 0 to 100 with higher scores indicating more severe impairment and worse quality of life.

arm_group.description: Participants who has been transitioned from ERTs/SRTs to VPRIV will be assesed for 12 months.

study_pop.textblock: Participants included have a diagnosis of GD1 and are currently being treated with another ERT/SRT for at least 6 months before the transition to VPRIV.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with Gaucher disease Type 1 (GD1) and currently being treated with another enzyme replacement therapy (ERT)/substrate reduction therapy (SRT) for at least 6 months before baseline enrolment.
- Participant or legally authorized representative has provided written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant is at high risk of non-compliance in the investigator's opinion.
- Participant is in the opinion of the investigator, unsuitable in any other way to participate in this study.
- Participant is pregnant.

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
